ygData.subject: Running job order.xml from commandline with our WebUI.
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I m trying to run Heritrix on the command line under Windows. If I start it like this. foreground_heritrix --admin=something:something This is works

Hi,

I'm trying to run Heritrix on the command line under Windows.

If I st=
art it like this.

"foreground_heritrix --admin=3Dsomething:something"

Thi=
s is works fine. I can log in, setup a job, and run it.

I want to take a o=
rder.xml file, and run it from the command line
without the WebUI. I also a=
ssume that Heritrix will exit, when it's
done running the job.

So I tried.=


"foreground_heritrix -nowui order.xml"

It doesn't work, and displays thi=
s on the screen. I've tried to supply
the "--admin=3Dsomething:something", =
but it still doesn't work.

-------------------

Invalid admin login:passwo=
rd value, or none specified. 
Usage: heritrix --help
Usage: heritrix --nowu=
i ORDER.XML
Usage: heritrix [--port=3D#] [--run] [--bind=3DIP,IP...]
--admi=
n=3DLOGIN:PASSWORD \
	[ORDER.XML]
Usage: heritrix [--port=3D#] --selftest[=
=3DTESTNAME]
Version: 1.12.1
Options:
 -b,--bind       Comma-separated list=
 of IP addresses or hostnames for web
                 server to listen on.=
  Set to / to listen on all available
                 network interfaces. =
 Default is 127.0.0.1.
 -a,--admin      Login and password for web user int=
erface administration.
                 Required (unless passed via the 'he=
ritrix.cmdline.admin'
                 system property).  Pass value of the=
 form
'LOGIN:PASSWORD'.
 -h,--help       Prints this message and exits.
 -n=
,--nowui      Put heritrix into run mode and begin crawl using
ORDER.XML. D=
o
                 not put up web user interface.
 -p,--port       Port to =
run web user interface on.  Default: 8080.
 -r,--run        Put heritrix in=
to run mode. If ORDER.XML begin crawl.
 -s,--selftest   Run the integrated =
selftests. Pass test name to test
it only
                 (Case sensitive:=
 E.g. pass 'Charset' to run charset
selftest).
Arguments:
 ORDER.XML       =
Crawl order to run.


Heritrix failed to start properly. Possible causes:

=
- Login and password have not been specified (see --admin switch)
- another=
 program uses the port for the web UI (8080 by default)
  (e.g. another Her=
itrix instance)
- JMX password file is missing or permissions not set corre=
ctly

Do you want to try to fix the permissions (Y/N)?
